it thinks you're trying to read a zip archive. You got the arguments wrong...
you need -r to recursively zip a directory...
-r where?
zip -r -0 framework-res.apk /home/bruce/Desktop/5056/
-r means to zip a directory and all the files/subdirectories inside it, recursively...
zip -v -r -0 framework-res.apk /home/bruce/Desktop/5056/   <-- added -v verbose flag so you can see what it's doing
the zip file should be in the current directory, named framework-res.apk.zip
check you 'man zip' manpage. It's possible your version of zip uses different args...
